body:
Yeah Hi PSA

Ty Tennant is underage so I’m literally begging you all:

do not comment anything weird. do not personally DM him. do not ask for personal information.

it’s weird, it’s wrong, it only makes you look bad and again:

He’s underage.

Follow him! Support him! Treat him as you would any other teen, but please be appropriate! :)

summary: Last night I dreamt that I was taking a Shakespeare class at university. I got to class really late on the first day (last ten...
body:
Last night I dreamt that I was taking a Shakespeare class at university. I got to class really late on the first day (last ten minutes of class late) and David Tennant was there! And for a moment I thought he was taking the class, but no, this really grumpy, sexist middle aged woman was taking it. David did not look happy.

The next day I go to class and the teacher is getting very frustrated because David isn’t letting her teach. We are reading a very errotic version of Romeo and Juliette (I had missed the worst of it by not going to class, but there was an inside joke about eels? (and Noel Fielding was there, siming the eels song from the mighty boosh, grinning like the Cheshire cat he is).

So whenever this woman says Anything David Tennant, who’s wearing a great t-shirt (i coundn’t read it so it must have been super awesome) pipes up and starts arguing with her. She is getting really upset and telling him to read the book, but he won’t, he keeps telling her that it’s wrong to say that men are smarter and stronger than women and that she shouldn’t be teaching Shakespeare.

Noel is still there, and now he’s hanging out with two actual eels (a certain sea witch comes to mind)

tags: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
title: Lazarus, Come Forth
body:
Pull up a chair, folks: we’re going to have a story. It is a cautionary tale of making promises you can’t easily keep, something many newly married couples and the Brexit delivery team have learned the hard way. It will not be easy reading, but there is a point, if you squint hard enough. It starts on a warm Monday afternoon and yours truly is about to do something rash.

“Listen,” I say to Phil…

View On WordPress

tags: I'll never get over this family
they were fans of each other
summary:
Time Crash - Behind the Scenes - Part Five  

Excerpts from Benjamin Cook’s interview with Peter Davison and David Tennant in...
caption:
Time Crash - Behind the Scenes - Part Five

Excerpts from Benjamin Cook’s interview with Peter Davison and David Tennant in DWM #389:

DWM: Why do you think your Doctors work together so well?

David Tennant: Had you written that question before you saw us do it today? [Laughs] I suppose we are quite similar. Maybe we have a similar kind of energy as well.

Peter Davison: There probably is a similar energy, yes. Although, I think that yours, David, is more controlled. Mine was out of desperation.

Tennant: I think you’re giving me the benefit of the doubt there!

Davison: I was thinking, the only thing that I’ve got going over Tom Baker is I’m younger and can move faster, so that’s really what I kind of played on. It was intimidating, following Tom.

DWM: Doesn’t it help, though, that other actors have played the Doctor before you? You can see what worked and what didn’t…

Davison: To me, it was always… not a problem, but… it wasn’t good or bad. You’re not employed to be like them; you’re employed to be different, really. You have to find your own Doctor, so you can’t use things too plainly. I mean, I used things - or tried to - from Patrick Troughton, because he was my Doctor.

Tennant: I think I probably do use things from Tom and Peter, who were my two. You do, I think, almost unconsciously, because that’s what you know that character to be, that’s how you first received it, so that’s how it’s imprinted in your internal databank. It’s inevitable that bits will come through - and then, of course, hopefully you add yourself to that mix.

DWM: Peter, you’ve said flattering things about David before now…

Tennant: Thank goodness for that

Davison: Yes, that’s a relief.

DWM: This interview would be rather awkward otherwise, wouldn’t it? What is it, then, that you admire about each other’s portrayals?

Davison: Well, I love the energy of it. It’s the quality of acting. It reminds me of the Patrick Troughton take-over from William Hartnell, because it is very difficult when you have a ‘first’ Doctor, which in effect, for lots of younger people, Chris Eccleston was, and then suddenly you have a new Doctor. That’s not an easy thing to do, and yet, within one episode, David made the part his own. It’s a hard thing to do. There were particular stories of mine where I just didn’t… you know, I didn’t quite know what I was doing at the beginning…

Other parts of this set: [ one ] [ two ] [ three ] [ four ]
[ Link to all my Doctor Who behind-the-scenes photosets ]

tags: idk if its true but hardy x rose showed up before hardy x miller
i like teninch fic but not at the expense of becoming more popular than how great the actual relationship was between hardy and miller
plus it feels like a slap in the face to olivia
i remember there used to be a
like why? there was no need
i love billie but tbh thank god that never happened it would have ruined the show
yes more than s3 already did
it wouldn’t be broadchurch anymore if that happened
that’s my irk with teninch fic. when it becomes too much and people don’t appreciate the actual great women david’s worked with
just so we can write a few smut scenes with dt characters and ofc. with billie’s only right?
because apparently EVERYTHING is really doctor x rose right? -.-
and ik it’s hypocritical cause all i write is teninch
but i that doesn’t mean that i like it more than canon stuff yknow
not like james x katie from the decoy bride weren’t adorable af
or will burton and his wife
someone legit wants to replace jennifer garner with billie for camping
i haven’t seen camping but I KNOW david and jennifer will be AMAZING
and tbh. i sometimes prefer dt x ocs over teninch. it breaks the mold i admire the hell outta authors who do that
ok sorry. rant over. my b. point is. i miss millardy a Lot
summary:
I disliked BC3 and most character plotlines and choices....
But I will never get over what an amazing and perfect duo Ellie...
body:
I disliked BC3 and most character plotlines and choices….

But I will never get over what an amazing and perfect duo Ellie Miller and Alec Hardy were. Looking at their interactions from s1 to s3 (s2) shows how much they grew to care and appreciate and maybe even truly love one another, and I miss it a lot.

reblog.comment:
I disliked BC3 and most character plotlines and choices….

But I will never get over what an amazing and perfect duo Ellie Miller and Alec Hardy were. Looking at their interactions from s1 to s3 (s2) shows how much they grew to care and appreciate and maybe even truly love one another, and I miss it a lot.

trail.content_raw:
I disliked BC3 and most character plotlines and choices….

But I will never get over what an amazing and perfect duo Ellie Miller and Alec Hardy were. Looking at their interactions from s1 to s3 (s2) shows how much they grew to care and appreciate and maybe even truly love one another, and I miss it a lot.
trail.content:
I disliked BC3 and most character plotlines and choices….

But I will never get over what an amazing and perfect duo Ellie Miller and Alec Hardy were. Looking at their interactions from s1 to s3 (s2) shows how much they grew to care and appreciate and maybe even truly love one another, and I miss it a lot.

summary:
A real conversation 
always contains an invitation. You are inviting another person to reveal
 herself or himself to you, to...
caption: A real conversation always contains an invitation. You are inviting another person to reveal herself or himself to you, to tell you who they are or what they want.-David Whyte

reblog.comment: A real conversation always contains an invitation. You are inviting another person to reveal herself or himself to you, to tell you who they are or what they want.-David Whyte

i almost watched all of the episodes on the classic who twitch stream today!!!

i read the novelization a while back
but oh man douglas adams is so good the whole serial was GREAT
AND K-9!!!!!! THE GOODEST BOY EVER

hopefully i can stay awake to watch the first half
but i doubt it since i'll need to get through the invasion of time
and i've only seen the first episode of that one
lmao @ the time lords' inflatable plastic cushions

summary:
*Me* I have to go to sleep early tonight.
*Me at 3:42 A.M.* When the tenth doctor fakes Scottish accent, is it actually David...
body:
*Me* I have to go to sleep early tonight.

*Me at 3:42 A.M.* When the tenth doctor fakes Scottish accent, is it actually David Tennant’s real Scottish accent?
